text: The COVID-19 pandemic was confirmed to have reached El Salvador on 18 March 2020. ==Numbers== As of 13 May 2020, El Salvador reported 1,112 cases, 20 deaths and 405 recoveries. On 31 March 2020, the first COVID-19 death in El Salvador was confirmed. ==Response== President Nayib Bukele banned public gathering of more than 500 people and shut down educational institutions on 17 March. ==Arrests== El Salvador had arrested more people for violating the quarantine than it had diagnosed cases of COVID-19, a total of 2,424 people had been arrested for violating quarantine orders, and 48,913 people had been tested for the virus. ==References== Category:21st century in El Salvador El Salvador
title: COVID-19 pandemic in El Salvador
